item.title: Before Hurricane Irene hits, New York planning to shut down transportation system, evacuate areas
item.description: Before Hurricane Irene hits, New York to shut down entire transportation system, plan evacuations: http://t.co/1r1dFOf
item.content:encoded: Before Hurricane Irene hits, New York to shut down entire transportation system, plan evacuations: http://t.co/1r1dFOf The city is planning to shut down the entire transportation system on Saturday in anticipation of Hurricane Irene's arrival, officials revealed Thursday. A mandatory evacuation of all nursing homes in flood-prone areas of the city was also ordered Thursday. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: nydailynews.com

item.description: Max Levchin to Leave Google As Slide Is Shut Down http://t.co/XSTW7j3
item.content:encoded: Max Levchin to Leave Google As Slide Is Shut Down http://t.co/XSTW7j3 Slide, the social apps company that Google bought just over a year ago for about $200 million, will be dissolved, and its esteemed leader Max Levchin will depart Google, sources close to the matter told AllThingsD and Google confirmed. Link - Trackbacks

item.description: Meet the 19-Year-Old Who Built Björk's 'Virus' App -- and Some of the First iPhone Apps Ever: Meet Max Weisel, t... http://t.co/xyz0AK9
item.content:encoded: Meet the 19-Year-Old Who Built Björk's 'Virus' App -- and Some of the First iPhone Apps Ever: Meet Max Weisel, t... http://t.co/xyz0AK9 Meet Max Weisel, the wunderkind who began experimenting with iPhone app development in his mid-teens. He was building iOS apps before Apple announced the App Store -- or even made an SDK available so developers could build official apps. Now his Soundrop app and his work with working with Björk's innovative app album is making waves. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Live from the Engadget reader meetup in NYC -- Engadget
item.description:
engadget Live from the Engadget reader meetup in NYC:
Are you in New York City? We sure are, and we want yo... http://t.co/TM0ZUmH
item.content:encoded: engadget Live from the Engadget reader meetup in NYC: Are you in New York City? We sure are, and we want yo... http://t.co/TM0ZUmH 6:08PM And we're here! Readers are lined up down the block. The rest of you are on your way, right? Are you in New York City? We sure are, and we want you to join us! Right now! We'll be at Guastavino's, located just under the Queensboro Bridge at 59th Street in Manhattan, until 10:30pm. Plenty of Engadget editors are on hand, along with our friends from Joystiq and TUAW, so be sure to swing on by if you're in the neighborhood. We're walking around with the latest gadgets, and may even have some for you to take home. Can't make it to the party? We have our cameras and laptops in tow, and we'll be adding photos and text throughout the night. Jump past the break to join in on the fun! Leave A Comment Read Here engadget, engadget reader meetup, EngadgetReaderMeetup, Guastavinos, keynote, liveblog, manhattan, meetup, new york, new york city, NewYork, NewYorkCity, party, reader meetup, ReaderMeetup Please enable JavaScript to view the comments powered by Disqus.blog comments powered by Disqus Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: engadget.com

item.content:encoded: For the good of the company? Five Apple products Steve Jobs killed http://t.co/yOUp5wN #IEEE #IEEEGreen Steve Jobs has creative vision, but just as important is his editorial eye. item.title: Dog mourns at casket of fallen Navy SEAL - TODAY Pets & Animals - TODAY.com
item.description: This brought tears to my eyes. The unconditional love from animals is amazing. http://t.co/PHJTZ0P
item.content:encoded: This brought tears to my eyes. The unconditional love from animals is amazing. http://t.co/PHJTZ0P Navy SEAL Jon Tumilson lay in a coffin, in front of a tearful audience mourning his death in Afghanistan. Soon an old friend appeared, and like a fellow soldier on a battlefield, his loyal dog refused to leave him behind. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Big Question (Answered): "What's Your Technology Frustration?"
item.description: Big Question (Answered): "What's Your Technology Frustration?" http://t.co/skAlluy
item.content:encoded: Big Question (Answered): "What's Your Technology Frustration?" http://t.co/skAlluy Technology is awesome, but getting routers to route and cords to not fray is not. No matter how wonderful it is that you can shake your arm at the tv and choose a movie on Netflix, it's that much more annoying when these lazy-maker devices cause us to work for some gratification. Surely we aren't alone in our frustration at having to wait, or worse, debug! So, we decided to ask our readers, "Do you have a recent example of technology frustration to share?" You answered and we culled your responses and used Storify to present it all back to... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com
